title: The fact that Ninja tabi is more often the not better than merc treads...
body:
Would seem to suggest that Tenacity is hardly an effective or reliable stat to be getting in the game anymore.

It use to reduce most CC but the past few seasons has had knock ups become far more common which is a large part of this items downfall.

Why buy a stat to reduce CC when it doesn't even reduce half the CC in the game?

I really hope you do something about this in preseason riot.

I'd say the reason knock up duration doesn't get reduced is because displacement skills (knockbacks and pulls) mainly function to move a target to a location, and if the TIME in which that happens is reduced, you'd probably get a noticeable distance nerf on top of the nerf to the duration of the disable. This probably won't be noticeable on knockups that are pretty much a buffed stun (Ali, Malphite, J4) but will affect things like Thresh's E. As funny as it is to see Lee's kick get a massive range nerf too, I don't think it is a good idea overall.

I don't think the problem is the prevalence of knockups; the problem is that all of the CC durations got nerfed into oblivion so now the difference between a .75 second stun and a .5 second stun doesn't feel very significant.

For tenacity to really get its value, Riot would need to bring back the durations to 2 or more seconds, which'd probably be fine: league needs longer CC's, especially in the hands of melee champs.

Not only the shift towards displacement CC (which has greater gameplay clarity and overall health) but the trend towards shortening CCs that do exist (stuns rarely go over 2 seconds, with most in the 1 second or less range and many receiving nerfs as well).
knock-ups devalue suppression by a lot, so what they should do is make knock-ups reduced with tenacity.
